text:
I created a custom classloader without extending the WebappClassLoader for 
loading encrypted/modified/autogenerating classes and it worked with 4.0.3, 
4.1.18, and 4.1.9.  Although, it fails to see jar files in the 
tomcat/common/lib or classes directory in 4.1.24.

I was using the following context with an independent CustomClassLoader:

<Context path="/mypath" docBase="mybase" debug="0" reloadable="true" 
crossContext="true">
</Context>

I would have used a <Loader tag in the tomcat/conf/server.xml file, but it 
fails to load webapp/WEB-INF/classes/loader/CustomClassLoader.

Working Context for a CustomClassLoader that extends WebappClassLoader:

<Context path="/mypath" docBase="mybase" debug="0" reloadable="true" 
crossContext="true">
<Loader className="org.apache.catalina.WebappLoader" delegate="false" 
loaderClass="loader.CustomClassLoader" />
</Context>

This works but only as described below and not how it should work.

I can fix the problem by placing it in the tomcat/server/classes/, but I do 
not want to make the CustomClassLoader available to all webapps.  This can 
cause major security issues.  It should allow me to use a custom class loader 
from the webapp/WEB-INF/classes path, but it fails to find it.
creator: travisberthelot@hotmail.com

text:
I had to use the ClassLoader of the tags as the parent for my custom 
ClassLoader.  It was not needed in previous versions because the system 
classloader loaded the servlet.jar instead of the WebappClassLoader.
